reason.tex: \begin{align} BM + BN &= 70\implies\dfrac{d}{dT}BM + \dfrac{d}{dT}BN = 0 \\ \therefore \dfrac{d}{dT}BM &= -\dfrac{d}{dT}BN \to (1)\\ AB^2 &= 50^2 = AM^2 + BM^2 \\ \therefore \dfrac{d}{dT}AB^2 &= 0 = 2\cdot AM\dfrac{d}{dT}AM+2\cdot BM\dfrac{d}{dT}BM\\ \therefore \dfrac{d}{dT}AM &= -\dfrac{BM}{AM}\cdot\dfrac{d}{dT}BM \\ &= -\dfrac{40}{\sqrt{50^2-40^2}}\cdot\dfrac{d}{dT}BM \\ &= -\dfrac{4}{3}\dfrac{d}{dT} BM \to (2) \end{align}

\begin{align} BC^2 &= 50^2 = BN^2 + CN^2 \\ \therefore \dfrac{d}{dT}BC^2 &= 0 = 2\cdot CN\dfrac{d}{dT}CN+2\cdot BN\dfrac{d}{dT}BN\\ \therefore \dfrac{d}{dT}CN &= -\dfrac{BN}{CN}\cdot\dfrac{d}{dT}BN \\ &= -\dfrac{30}{\sqrt{50^2-30^2}}\cdot\dfrac{d}{dT}BN \\ &= -\dfrac{3}{4}\dfrac{d}{dT} BN = \underbrace{\dfrac{3}{4}\dfrac{d}{dT}BM}_{\frac{d}{dT}BM = -\frac{d}{dT}BN}\\ &= \dfrac{3}{4}\cdot \underbrace{\left(-\dfrac{3}{4}\dfrac{d}{dT}AM\right)} _{\frac{d}{dT}AM = -\frac{4}{3}\frac{d}{dT} BM} = -\dfrac{9}{16}\dfrac{d}{dT}AM \\ \therefore \underbrace{\dfrac{d}{dT}AM}_{\text{A's speed}} &= -\dfrac{16}{9}\underbrace{\dfrac{d}{dT}CN}_{\text{C's speed}} \\ &= -\dfrac{16}{9}\times\text{ 3 m/s} = -\dfrac{16}{3}\text{ m/s.} \end{align} \\ \underline{\text{The negative sign only means that A and C}} \\ \underline{\text{are moving in opposite directions.}}
